page.title: 15The Tourist Industry.
page.content: Tourism has become of great importance in our area due to the decline of heavy industry. Many industrial sites and tips have been flattened out and grassed to restore much of the area's former beauty. To attract tourists to our area we have golf courses, swmming baths and numerous leisure centres. You can fish locally and there is pony trekking and walking near by. Special events in our area consist of sheepdog trials, hot air balloon fair, a country fair, ploughing and hedging competitions and a weekly market at Blackwood. Tourists will find numerous eating places which vary from hotels to pubs. The Plas Inn, for example, is a 16th century farm house which offers food and refreshment to visitors. Our area makes an ideal centre for touring to many historical places of interest.
